verses.kjv: Now after these things, in the reign of Artaxerxes king of Persia, Ezra the son of Seraiah, the son of Azariah, the son of Hilkiah,
verses.web: Now after these things, in the reign of Artaxerxes king of Persia, Ezra the son of Seraiah, the son of Azariah, the son of Hilkiah,
verses.ct: After all of this, during the reign of King Artaxerxes of Persia, a man named Ezra traveled to Jerusalem. He was the son of Seraiah, son of Azariah, son of Hilkiah,

verses.kjv: The son of Shallum, the son of Zadok, the son of Ahitub,
verses.web: the son of Shallum, the son of Zadok, the son of Ahitub,
verses.ct: son of Shallum, son of Zadok, son of Ahitub,

verses.kjv: The son of Amariah, the son of Azariah, the son of Meraioth,
verses.web: the son of Amariah, the son of Azariah, the son of Meraioth,
verses.ct: son of Amariah, son of Azariah, son of Meraioth,

verses.kjv: The son of Zerahiah, the son of Uzzi, the son of Bukki,
verses.web: the son of Zerahiah, the son of Uzzi, the son of Bukki,
verses.ct: son of Zerahiah, son of Uzzi, son of Bukki,

verses.kjv: The son of Abishua, the son of Phinehas, the son of Eleazar, the son of Aaron the chief priest:
verses.web: the son of Abishua, the son of Phinehas, the son of Eleazar, the son of Aaron the chief priest—
verses.ct: son of Abishua, son of Phinehas, son of Eleazar, son of Aaron the chief priest.

verses.kjv: This Ezra went up from Babylon; and he was a ready scribe in the law of Moses, which the LORD God of Israel had given: and the king granted him all his request, according to the hand of the LORD his God upon him.
verses.web: this Ezra went up from Babylon. He was a skilled scribe in the law of Moses, which LORD, the God of Israel, had given; and the king granted him all his request, according to LORD his God’s hand on him.
verses.ct: This Ezra came up from Babylon. He was an expert scribe in the law of Moses, which the LORD God of Israel had given. The king gave him everything he asked for, because the hand of the LORD his God was on him.

verses.kjv: And there went up some of the children of Israel, and of the priests, and the Levites, and the singers, and the porters, and the Nethinims, unto Jerusalem, in the seventh year of Artaxerxes the king.
verses.web: Some of the children of Israel, including some of the priests, the Levites, the singers, the gatekeepers, and the temple servants went up to Jerusalem in the seventh year of Artaxerxes the king.
verses.ct: A group of Israelites traveled with him to Jerusalem in the 7th year of King Artaxerxes — including priests, Levites, singers, gatekeepers, and temple servants.

verses.kjv: And he came to Jerusalem in the fifth month, which was in the seventh year of the king.
verses.web: He came to Jerusalem in the fifth month, which was in the seventh year of the king.
verses.ct: Ezra arrived in Jerusalem in the 5th month of the king's 7th year.

verses.kjv: For upon the first day of the first month began he to go up from Babylon, and on the first day of the fifth month came he to Jerusalem, according to the good hand of his God upon him.
verses.web: For on the first day of the first month he began to go up from Babylon; and on the first day of the fifth month he came to Jerusalem, according to the good hand of his God on him.
verses.ct: He had left Babylon on the 1st day of the 1st month and arrived in Jerusalem on the 1st day of the 5th month, because the good hand of his God was on him.

verses.kjv: For Ezra had prepared his heart to seek the law of the LORD, and to do it, and to teach in Israel statutes and judgments.
verses.web: For Ezra had set his heart to seek LORD’s law, and to do it, and to teach statutes and ordinances in Israel.
verses.ct: Ezra had devoted himself to studying the law of the LORD, living it out, and teaching its statutes and judgments to Israel.

verses.kjv: Now this is the copy of the letter that the king Artaxerxes gave unto Ezra the priest, the scribe, even a scribe of the words of the commandments of the LORD, and of his statutes to Israel.
verses.web: Now this is the copy of the letter that the king Artaxerxes gave to Ezra the priest, the scribe, even the scribe of the words of LORD’s commandments, and of his statutes to Israel:
verses.ct: Here is a copy of the letter that King Artaxerxes gave to Ezra the priest and scribe — a scholar of the LORD's commandments and statutes given to Israel:

verses.kjv: Artaxerxes, king of kings, unto Ezra the priest, a scribe of the law of the God of heaven, perfect peace, and at such a time.
verses.web: Artaxerxes, king of kings, To Ezra the priest, the scribe of the law of the perfect God of heaven. Now
verses.ct: "From Artaxerxes, king of kings, to Ezra the priest, scribe of the law of the God of heaven. Greetings.

verses.kjv: I make a decree, that all they of the people of Israel, and of his priests and Levites, in my realm, which are minded of their own freewill to go up to Jerusalem, go with thee.
verses.web: I make a decree, that all those of the people of Israel, and their priests and the Levites, in my realm, who intend of their own free will to go to Jerusalem, go with you.
verses.ct: I hereby decree that any of the people of Israel living in my kingdom — including their priests and Levites — who freely choose to go to Jerusalem may travel with you.

verses.kjv: Forasmuch as thou art sent of the king, and of his seven counsellors, to enquire concerning Judah and Jerusalem, according to the law of thy God which is in thine hand;
verses.web: Because you are sent by the king and his seven counselors, to inquire concerning Judah and Jerusalem, according to the law of your God which is in your hand,
verses.ct: You are being sent by the king and his 7 counselors to investigate conditions in Judah and Jerusalem based on the law of your God, which you carry with you.

verses.kjv: And to carry the silver and gold, which the king and his counsellors have freely offered unto the God of Israel, whose habitation is in Jerusalem,
verses.web: and to carry the silver and gold, which the king and his counselors have freely offered to the God of Israel, whose habitation is in Jerusalem,
verses.ct: You are also to bring the silver and gold that the king and his counselors have freely given to the God of Israel, whose dwelling is in Jerusalem.

verses.kjv: And all the silver and gold that thou canst find in all the province of Babylon, with the freewill offering of the people, and of the priests, offering willingly for the house of their God which is in Jerusalem:
verses.web: and all the silver and gold that you will find in all the province of Babylon, with the free will offering of the people, and of the priests, offering willingly for the house of their God which is in Jerusalem;
verses.ct: In addition, collect whatever silver and gold you can find throughout the province of Babylon, along with the freewill offerings that the people and priests choose to give for the house of their God in Jerusalem.

verses.kjv: That thou mayest buy speedily with this money bullocks, rams, lambs, with their meat offerings and their drink offerings, and offer them upon the altar of the house of your God which is in Jerusalem.
verses.web: therefore you shall with all diligence buy with this money bulls, rams, lambs, with their meal offerings and their drink offerings, and shall offer them on the altar of the house of your God which is in Jerusalem.
verses.ct: Use this money right away to buy bulls, rams, and lambs, along with their grain offerings and drink offerings, and present them on the altar of the house of your God in Jerusalem.

verses.kjv: And whatsoever shall seem good to thee, and to thy brethren, to do with the rest of the silver and the gold, that do after the will of your God.
verses.web: Whatever seems good to you and to your brothers to do with the rest of the silver and the gold, do that according to the will of your God.
verses.ct: Whatever you and your fellow priests decide to do with the remaining silver and gold, do it according to the will of your God.

verses.kjv: The vessels also that are given thee for the service of the house of thy God, those deliver thou before the God of Jerusalem.
verses.web: The vessels that are given to you for the service of the house of your God, deliver before the God of Jerusalem.
verses.ct: As for the vessels given to you for service in the house of your God, deliver them all to the God of Jerusalem.

verses.kjv: And whatsoever more shall be needful for the house of thy God, which thou shalt have occasion to bestow, bestow it out of the king’s treasure house.
verses.web: Whatever more will be needed for the house of your God, which you may have occasion to give, give it out of the king’s treasure house.
verses.ct: If anything else is needed for the house of your God, pay for it from the royal treasury.

verses.kjv: And I, even I Artaxerxes the king, do make a decree to all the treasurers which are beyond the river, that whatsoever Ezra the priest, the scribe of the law of the God of heaven, shall require of you, it be done speedily,
verses.web: I, even I Artaxerxes the king, make a decree to all the treasurers who are beyond the River, that whatever Ezra the priest, the scribe of the law of the God of heaven, requires of you, it shall be done with all diligence,
verses.ct: I, King Artaxerxes, also decree that all the treasurers in the province west of the Euphrates River must give Ezra the priest — the scribe of the law of the God of heaven — whatever he requests, without delay.

verses.kjv: Unto an hundred talents of silver, and to an hundred measures of wheat, and to an hundred baths of wine, and to an hundred baths of oil, and salt without prescribing how much.
verses.web: up to one hundred talents of silver, and to one hundred cors of wheat, and to one hundred baths of wine, and to one hundred baths of oil, and salt without prescribing how much.
verses.ct: This includes up to 100 talents of silver, 100 measures of wheat, 100 baths of wine, 100 baths of oil, and as much salt as needed.

verses.kjv: Whatsoever is commanded by the God of heaven, let it be diligently done for the house of the God of heaven: for why should there be wrath against the realm of the king and his sons?
verses.web: Whatever is commanded by the God of heaven, let it be done exactly for the house of the God of heaven; for why should there be wrath against the realm of the king and his sons?
verses.ct: Whatever the God of heaven commands, let it be carried out fully for the house of the God of heaven. Why should we risk bringing his wrath down on the king and his sons?

verses.kjv: Also we certify you, that touching any of the priests and Levites, singers, porters, Nethinims, or ministers of this house of God, it shall not be lawful to impose toll, tribute, or custom, upon them.
verses.web: Also we inform you that it shall not be lawful to impose tribute, custom, or toll, on any of the priests, Levites, singers, gatekeepers, temple servants, or laborers of this house of God.
verses.ct: Furthermore, be aware that no one may impose taxes, tribute, or customs duties on any of the priests, Levites, singers, gatekeepers, temple servants, or other workers in this house of God.

verses.kjv: And thou, Ezra, after the wisdom of thy God, that is in thine hand, set magistrates and judges, which may judge all the people that are beyond the river, all such as know the laws of thy God; and teach ye them that know them not.
verses.web: You, Ezra, according to the wisdom of your God that is in your hand, appoint magistrates and judges, who may judge all the people who are beyond the River, who all know the laws of your God; and teach him who doesn’t know them.
verses.ct: And you, Ezra, using the wisdom your God has given you, appoint magistrates and judges to govern all the people west of the Euphrates River — everyone who knows the laws of your God. Those who don't know them, you must teach.

verses.kjv: And whosoever will not do the law of thy God, and the law of the king, let judgment be executed speedily upon him, whether it be unto death, or to banishment, or to confiscation of goods, or to imprisonment.
verses.web: Whoever will not do the law of your God and the law of the king, let judgment be executed on him with all diligence, whether it is to death, or to banishment, or to confiscation of goods, or to imprisonment.
verses.ct: Anyone who refuses to obey the law of your God or the law of the king must be punished swiftly — whether by death, banishment, seizure of property, or imprisonment."

verses.kjv: Blessed be the LORD God of our fathers, which hath put such a thing as this in the king’s heart, to beautify the house of the LORD which is in Jerusalem:
verses.web: Blessed be LORD, the God of our fathers, who has put such a thing as this in the king’s heart, to beautify LORD’s house which is in Jerusalem;
verses.ct: Praise the LORD, the God of our ancestors, who put it in the king's heart to honor and beautify the house of the LORD in Jerusalem!

verses.kjv: And hath extended mercy unto me before the king, and his counsellors, and before all the king’s mighty princes. And I was strengthened as the hand of the LORD my God was upon me, and I gathered together out of Israel chief men to go up with me.
verses.web: and has extended loving kindness to me before the king and his counselors, and before all the king’s mighty princes. I was strengthened according to LORD my God’s hand on me, and I gathered together chief men out of Israel to go up with me.
verses.ct: He showed me mercy before the king, his counselors, and all the king's powerful officials. Because the hand of the LORD my God was on me, I found the strength to gather leading men from Israel to go with me.
